title.value: Outcomes of guidelines from health technology assessment organizations in community-based primary care: a systematic mixed studies review
title.justification: The title explicitly states the focus on outcomes of guidelines from HTA organizations in primary care.
title.quote: Outcomes of guidelines from health technology assessment organizations in community-based primary care: a systematic mixed studies review.

extractions.description: This paper presents a systematic mixed studies review focusing on the outcomes of guidelines from health technology assessment (HTA) organizations within community-based primary care. The review classifies outcomes into various dimensions and emphasizes the need for a systematic exploration of these outcomes in future evaluations.

type.justification: The paper conducts a systematic review and analysis of empirical studies related to outcomes of HTA guidelines.
type.quote: We performed a systematic mixed studies review of empirical studies that (a) referred to a published guideline from an HTA organization and (b) reported an outcome resulting from a guideline.

name.justification: The paper deals primarily with evaluating the outcomes of HTA guidelines.
name.quote: These leading organizations conduct investigations funded by their respective governments and publish their results as HTA knowledge products, taking the form of guidelines, reports, patient education handouts, or educational videos.

name.justification: The paper focuses on HTA guidelines' outcomes within community-based primary health care settings.
name.quote: The purpose of this review is to explore and measure the outcomes of guidelines from health technology assessment (HTA) organizations in community-based primary care (CBPHC).
